column11: Review Text

our hotel was connected to the lake and really the has made a wonderful view , it was very beautiful early in morning and sun fall . I saw boating on the lake . thee were also seagulls ,... in different parts of the lake . walking around the lake is recommended.
Beira Lake is a lake in the centre of Colombo. The average depth is 18 feet and it is surrounded by many large businesses in the city

This lake in Colombo is a really nice spot, both for the temple on the water and for the lovely ride on swan boats. You can rent one for 30 minuts and pedal on the water among many smily local people. The atmosphere is great and you will get a nice view of the city buildings surrounding the lake.

Beira lake is an artificial lake, close to the centre of Colombo. It  has a Buddhist temple inside the lake that you can visit paying an entry fees. Besides the Seema Malakaya Temple, there is  Lovers’ Island that you can reach through a bridge. The island is surrounded by trees with a nice breeze. It is a great idea to enjoy some hours  at the island, avoiding the humidity and pollution of the city.

column8: Tranquil escape from the busy streets
column11: Really nice lake that is well maintained. It's beautiful to walk around and recommend crossing the bridge to the small resting area. The temple is also quite nice, and entry will get you into the other main Buddha temple.

Beira lake had a Buddhist temple inside the lake. There are entry fees for entering the temple. And it has a boating service inside the which was not operational due to some technical issues on the third week of November. We have a bridge which connects the island located on the middle of the lake the bridge is little broken. Island is surrounded by trees with a nice breeze across good way to escape from the humidity of the city.

column8: Nice quaint artificial lake in the heart of the city.
column11: It's in the center of the city, still you feel certain calm when you come here. I have been to Colombo twice and this lake and Seema Malaka temple and this lake have been my favorite both times. You can sit in Seema Malakaya temple for hours staring at this lake calmly and you won't get bored. It's very peaceful. And they also play some spiritual music in the temple every now and then. It only adds to the beauty.
beira lake  is a lake in the center of the city of Colombo in Sri Lanka. The lake is surrounded by many large businesses in the city

Beira Lake is one of the most prominent landmarks in Colombo. It's located right at the center of the city and a perfect place that combines beauty and relaxation within the city limits. It is said that the lake used to be much bigger over a century ago, however as of present day, it has been scaled down to about 150 acres as a result of the rapid commercialization. According to the records, the lake has been created by Portuguese to protect their base during 1500s and then evolved to be a landmark during the British ruling and on. As of late, it became famous for a number of recreational activities, such as rowing and yachting. In conclusion, it could be said as a decent place for en evening walk or to relax within the city limits.
It’s one of the most romantic place to enjoy in Sri Lanka... Birds are everywhere around you. You enjoy sitting with your partner and the nice scenery...
There is this small lake in Colombo city which is also home of seema malaka temple. Good place to go in evening.
A lake in middle of city. Beautiful surroundings. This also host the famous Seema malaka temple and a suspension bridge

When looking at the lake the first thing that is noticed is, how crazy (florescent)green it is, (we were told by our guide it was due to pollution), there is a small (buddhist) shrine wth connections to Gangaramaya Temple, (see review).

Its very beautiful most Altair and its very beautiful view lake small cute. Most light morning best easy can see them place and but night is ok but better morning beautiful more take pictures :-) tourist can visit take pictures become beautiful memories

Beira Lake is located behind the Colombo Fort train station while South Beira Lake is smaller size further down facing Colombo City Center Mall. I stayed at a hostel at Vauxhall Street and capitalized on the near distance to the two lakes to explore the area. Beira Lake reminded me of the old Singapore River unsightly and with a foul smell, nothing fascinating or enchanting. But the fact that the lake occupies a central position in the bustling commercial hub of Colombo, it can capitalize on her strategic location to regenerate and revitalize itself from a lackluster lake to a clean and picturesque lake that promote the dynamism of this metropolis city. The old smelly Singapore River went through a stage of rejuvenation, purification and transformation to evolve into a sparkling body of water that blends beautifully and harmoniously with the spectacular skyline of the skyscrapers surrounding her. Undisputedly, the river has become an iconic structure that catapults Singapore into the forefront of the financial world. I think Beira Lake has the same potential to transform herself and advertise Sri Lanka to the world. South Beira Lake is much more beautiful than the mother Lake itself. It is where the Seema Malakaya Buddhist meditation temple is located. It is more well-design with clearly defined contours and appears calm and serene matching the temple and the surrounding buildings. The Colombo City Centre mall is located opposite the Buddhist Temple. I went up to the upper floor of the mall where the food studio was located and found the panoramic lake view gorgeous. The Colombo Lotus Tower stands like a torch at one end of the Beira Lake. It reminds one that this is a Buddhist country. The lotus flower blooms out of the mud. The lotus flower represents potential, enlightenment and spiritual awakening. The lay person is born into this muddy world of ignorance but he has the potential to achieve enlightenment out from this `muddy' world. The Beira Lake really looks muddy. The Colombo Fort Train station, the Pettah market area, the Bally's Casino, the Sri Lanka Air Force Headquarters, the Slave Island Police Station, the Lake House colonial architectural building, the Regal Cinema theatre and the Cinnamon Lake Hotel are few `attractions' in the vicinity of the Beira Lake. I was impressed with the elegant interior layout of the 4-star Cinnamon Lake Hotel. I also visited a nearby church and some street art gallery while exploring the lake. In fact, I explored the entire shore of the Beira Lake when I walked from the Colombo  Fort train station to the Maradana train station. I noticed there are a number of warehouses at this south part of the lake. There is no `wow' factor for this Beira Lake but if you are staying around the Slave Island area, you definitely will come across this Lake and looming Lotus Tower from a distance.

What a shame that the city can’t sort out the water. This lake should be cleaned to become a place of beauty in the middle of the city. Somewhere that local people could come and enjoy in their spare time. We walked all the way round and the paths have trip hazards all over the place, they need repairing desperately. The island in the middle of the lake houses a temple which we did not visit also there is a temple which again only viewed from the pathway. Tried to find out why the lake is green but couldn’t get a definitive answer from anyone. Worst of all at certain points around the lake the smell which I assumed was sewage was disgusting.

Quite a large City Lake surrounded by busy roads, and on one side in particular many high rise buildings with more being constructed. If you fancy it there are swan shaped pedelos for hire, but the water is very polluted with a pea green soup look about it. However, there is a beautiful Buddhist Temple set in the lake. (We didn't visit, as we were "templed out" on our last full day in Sri Lanka). But we bought ice creams on the lake shore and crossed the bridge to the small island park to enjoy them in peace and quiet, (rare in Colombo), and that was the highlight of the place for us. Oh! and we did spot a terrapin in the water.

A manmade Lake in the heart of Colombo which also has Seema Malaka Temple where tourist & locals can visit to meditate & have a peaceful time spent in a busy city dwelling... if one wants to visit the Temple there is a ticket for LKR300/- to be purchased at the entrance...
The lake is surrounded by massive construction projects, but still manages to project an image of peace and quiet.
This is a  lake in the city centre  in front of the Colombo city centre shopping complex. There is a beautiful Buddhist temple in the middle. The lighting is beautiful in the night.

Its a large lake, located in the center of the Colombo City, which is believed to have be built by Portuguese colonizers, while in the process of constructing a moat around the fort. The lake has many commercial buildings on its banks. New and modern, high rise buildings have also started coming up along it banks. Effort is being made to develop the lake front to attract tourist and the locals. The small temple has been constructed on the lake and an island in the middle of the lake has been developed into a Park, which is accessed by a cable stay foot bridge. The park is frequented by young lovers, who seem to be behind every bush. There are lot water bird on the lake. The water of the lake is having a unpleasant odor and appears polluted.

It is a huge lake and very close to the Gangaramaya Temple in the heart of city. The water is polluted hence the color green. The lake connects with other lakes through narrow canals and ends up in the Indian sea. The lake is a nice and peaceful place to seat enjoy the sightseeing.
The lake provides a reprieve from the hustle and bustle...and the impatient 'blue' bus drivers. Very nice surrounds.

A small lake, in the heart of the city of Colombo. Nice to walk around, there is a small temple on the lake, where many Buddhist weddings take place, Its called "THE SEEMA MALAKAYA" It would be nicer, if the lake was much cleaner.
This is a small lake located in the heart of the city. The lake temple is located in this lake only. Best to visit on evening

Seema Malaka a Budhist temple is well worth looking at and if you want to avoid the crowds dont go on a Poya (Full Moon) day. Going just before sunset can provide some great pictures and also very relaxing to just sit on the wall and people watch. You might also be lucky to see an Asian Water Monitor, well I think that's what i saw.
So Colombo has a lake too. Nice a very small one clean lake. This only have the famous lake temple. Nice to visit in evening

Once called Beira Lake as Kunu Ela. Due to pollution lake got bad odour and multi colors. During President Mahinda Rajapaksha period lake restored and started boat services as well. Now this location is beautiful place.

Nice lake near Prime Ministers office, walk around the lake is about 2 kilometres but one side stinks very badly so that you don't like completing the full circle. Temple on the lake is very beautiful, they charge 300 Sri Lankan rupees for foreign visitors. This fee covers visit to Gangaramiya temple about 150 meters from this lake.
Place to be a fun place, but flock with lovers....its sort of a lovers park??? i m not quit sure..but nice place to relax and fun for kids..good surrounding....some times smells so bad that area.

Peculiarly for Colombo the lakeside offers shade during the day so you can take your coffee or ice cream (from one of the growing number of smart outlets in the area) and enjoy beside the lake. It's a cooler and much different place at night, when the lights reflect off the water and you could believe there was magic in the air. There are duck shaped paddle boats for everyone else.

We stopped off at the lake between the temples and took a walk out to the island, which seems to be popular for both young love and tortoises, before having a ride on the swan boats.  Nice relaxing break between temples.

This is a very pretty lake in the middle of a busy city we walked all around and onto the Island, it is pretty with some interesting local wild life, my main disappointment was the trash and the water colour it was putrid green, it maybe the time of the year when algae is in bloom  - I hope so ! To be fair there were some staff removing the trash but there is a lot of construction going on lake side so maybe this is why ?

In the business of Colombo, a gentle walk round Beira Lake is relaxing. There is a Buddhist temple in the middle which has paid entry.We had the pleasure of meeting the Army's Elephant Mascot, aged 70, who was also on a constitutional around the lake.

The lake is quite pretty and covers a huge area.It has a bridge that takes you to a man made island where lovers seem to sit for hours staring at the water.Very peaceful place.Worth the visit just to wind down and chill.Pity about the new high rise building being built next door spoiling the skyline

Beira Lake lies in the heart of this rapidly developing and busy city and for anyone staying in one of the numerous hotels in the vicinity it offers a tranquil environment to walk and enjoy the water. It is actually two bodies of water linked by a canal and is of historic significance for its use in the transportation of goods across the city. Aside from walking around it, visitors can take boat rides and visit the Temple that is situated on a small island. Over the years this area has been significantly developed in line with the huge amount of redevelopment taking place in the city as a whole.

The lake is nothing special in itself apart from the fact that there is a temple on a small island that you can visit. It is simply a body of water in a city that really lacks major parks and green spaces. There is a bit of boating but not much else apart from walking around the banks. The views of the city are nice.
Surrounded by roads and construction and the lake really stinks and you might harassed. Still, there’s a small island with a sort of park where you can sit and get views of the city and ducks.
A nice waterbody in the concrete jungle, it also has a temple and boating activity. Its pleasant to have a morning walk or evening walk around the lake.

This oldest place is located near in Colombo City and made by human beings in early days. There are boat riding, nice park in the mid Island. Good place to walk around. And this place is located near to Bishops College and Buddhist temple.

Nice place to do boating with few species of birds & sometimes lovebirds too surrounding you. The park centrally located around the lake connected by a nice small bridge gives a beautiful look. Avoid staying in dark to avoid being welcome with sweet mosquito buzz.

The lake is in the middle of a built-up area and provides a nice relief from the bustle of the city.  It will take you about 15 minutes to walk round the lake, which also has a little temple bordering it.

Beira Lake is a very old man-made lake located in the heart of the Colombo city, was made by the Portuguese during colonial era. It’s now surrounded by many skyscrapers. The pathways just around the Lake and the pavements on the road level have been stunningly built. The place is really green and it's a beautiful place to walk through, with the giant trees and the view of the beautiful lake. It’s located near to the Gangarama Temple and Viharamahadevi Park. The giant suspension bridge on the lake is a nice piece of work to observe. Evening is the best time for the visitors to roaming around the place.
This is a very nice lake and the local rowing club is always active on it. I think so much more could be done with this lake but considering the past it came already a long way.

If you're expecting a grand lake, then let me tell you that you would be heartbroken. It is centrally located and hosts the place where I have seen a lot of people getting married. It is maybe an outdoor extension of the Gangaramaya temple. The city authority are erecting some pretty tall buildings in the surrounding and as a result the lake has more become like a dump swamp.
The Beira lake has a little island with a temple. It is a place for walks and local courting couples. There is much redevelopment in the area and the lake is badly in need of cleaning.
Just walk from the the road to the temple and surroundings to feel a sense of serenity. See the buildings around and say to yourself - it's nicer here.
The idea of this lake and the floating Market in the Heart of Colombo Fort area was good it's just a shame that the shops seem to be half empty...
Not the cleanest Lakes in the world but quite a good place to relax and enjoy sundown in the midst of the Colombo city.

This is a man made lake located in the heart of the Colombo, surrounded by many   skyscrapers. It was made by Portuguese during colonial era for many purposes. One is to protect Colombo Fort from local kings. Both king Mayadunne and Seethawaka Rajasingha attacked Colombo Fort but could not be defeated. It is said that Beira lake was highly infested with crocodiles, but not now. Beira lake was mach larger earlier and it had been connected with intricate system of canals providing a way of transportation in Colombo. Currently there are two islands in the lake. One is splendid Seema malaka viharaya and other one is known as "Kala Doowa" (Kala Island). Seema malakaya contains a wooden pavilion which is covered by blue color  roofing tiles. It is designed by well known architect - Bevis Bava. This small island also contains a stupa, bodhi tree and small shrines for local gods and goddesses. If you are planing to go there mind your dress since this is a religious place. The pavilion is surrounded by many buddha statue. The Kala island is lover's hot spot. Its garden is maintained satisfactorily.  It is interesting to see some cute rabbits hop here and there. The main problem here is, the water is so polluted and contains a bad odor. It is due to an algae grown in this water. But it is not a big problem to have a swan boat ride here. This aquatic environment provides adequately good habitat for few aquatic fauna including egrets, pelicans and cormorants. Famous Gangarama Temple and Viharamahadevi park are located close by.

Urban area with offices around and construction going on. Couples everywhere and very crowded sometimes. Dirty and wet around the area. Lots of perverts around too who take pictures of girls on their cellphone. Not a good idea except for a quick jog or walk.

Visited the lake mainly to see the temple which was Really very beuatiful, but we actually enjoyed the calm of walking around the lake, but at the same time wished it was little cleaner though! We did our walk on a Sunday, so traffic was quiet, so it was quite peaceful walking around the lake. It's a nice escape from the noise of the city and an easy walk.

This was a manmade lake built by the Portuguese. The current size has been drastically reduced and is surrounded by many high rise buildings of the city center. You can almost see the lake as you drive past the city.

column7: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read ourtransparency reportto learn more.
column11: It should have been cleaner I guess. If it was then an ideal place for a walk. The Temple in the middle & the Island is exceptionally nice though.

A large lake with a steel bridge to cross over and relax in an island on the lake. The Lake periphery has a buddhist temple (one among the many in temples), this temple also like many of the other temples on a travellers to do list charges an entry fee for foreigners
We stayed nearby.. so could visit the lake and around.. It was Vesak festival so the lake was decorated,. Looked beautiful at night . A buddhist temple in the lake side worth visiting

This is place to visit during Vesak Festival happens in every year May. This is near Gangarama Temple and lot of things happening in that area during this festival. It is very colorful with Pandols ,Lanterns and lot of lights. Do not miss this sight happening in Colombo entire city during this period of the year. If you could not visit this year visit next year and feel the change in Colombo city during Vesak.

The Beira Lake is mainly in and around three roads namely D.R wijewardena Mw, Vauxall Street and T.B Jaya Mw and is in Colombo 2. It finally enters the sea near the old parliament. Its water is green colour due to the algae present which gives an attractive look that goes with the surrounding trees on its banks. It is a cooling place which is made by the trees around it. Be watchful as the temperature rises a little  during the afternoons as Colombo is warm and humid. It is very beautiful with the lighting in the night which glitters on water making a splendid sight. It is a place to do a walk on its periphery with friends and also do a chat or spend time with family members. Chairs are found in many places on the periphery of the lake and you could sit and admire the beauty. The full walking on its periphery takes about 30 minutes. In certain places, you find beautifying structures like statues of Prominent Persons, Roller display, and special artistic Street Lamps and artistic boundary chain with vertical structures etc. There is a Buddhist temple as centre of the attraction on the lake, which is  a sub temple of Gangaraymaya,  located 100 meters away, called as the Seema Malakaya; floating on water. It has many  Buddha statues and most of them of  peaceful posture types as well as some statues of some Hidu deities. There is a small bridge leading to the small middle of the lake small island and shading is given by a large tree. You can walk  to it by the small bridge and spend some time there. .The tress and some of them of blooming type give shade and add to the beauty of the periphery walk area.Most places are covered by lawns neatly maintained. payed path is seen round the periphery of the lake with certain area paved with locking type concrete stones. There is a pier spotted to give people to get a feeling on Beira lake water atmosphere. There are parking areas in most places around the periphery. Nelum kuluna is seen from here. Pelicans, crows and some other birds can be spotted. Swan Shaped Pedi-lows and Catamarans are offer for hire at the rate of LKR 150. Sri Lanka army runs a restaurant at a corner of the Beira Lake.
I had been too many times at Beira Lake, because its nears the hotel I'd stay! I love to go there when evening to see sun set and walking around!

The lake is in the middle of the city - however its dirty! There is a floating restaurant on this lake and I think that is the only reason you should be here - else avoid it. This trip will be an unnecessary strain on you in the hot sun!

Its a lake in the centre of the city of Colombo surrounded by many businesses of the city. It is lined with many large warehouses which is now abandoned . At one stage tea used to be transported to the port of Colombo on barges via the port access canal. Due to the algae present and pollution of the number of years the lake has  a bad  odour. There are many birds and  lizard around the lake. The Sri Lankan exhibition and convention centre is located on the waterfront, The Cinnamon  Lakeside Hotel is also  on this lakeside. The only good thing is ,the view is really beautiful. Once restored should be better.
The lake in it self with algaegreen water isnt that beautiful but make a nice open space in the cityscape. The lake is nothing you NEED to see.
This is a charming lake with temple shrines in Colpetty. It was once a swampy ghetto, but the monks at Gangaramaya Temple renovated the whole area, so that now it is pristine.
This is a big water body in colombo and colombo looks big enough with lot of structures and this lake  really gives a nice backdrop for anyside views.
Dinner cruise on Beira Lake in the center of Colombo, arranged by Cinnamon Lakeside. But the lake is rather small, so essentially the boat just goes in circles.  Scenery is pleasant, in any case.

Located in a high security area as it is next to the Prim Minister's residence the lakefront is not made people friendly. Lack of seats and places to relax as well as shade makes it quite a dehydrating exercise. A little island on the lake too has little cover and motivation to relax.

Went here to have a break while exploring Colombo. The place is nice, located a bit out in the lake. However, they could have cleaned the place up a bit. There is a lot of garbage around and the lake was green/brown from all the algea.
A beautiful lake in the heart of the city, best viewed from the Meditation Centre of Gangaramaya Temple.

Horrible and smelly ... bright green with algea there is a small number of swan boats but the smell is awful on a hot day ... there is an island over the bridge in the centre but not worth the trouble
- Suspension bridge is very nice - Swan boats are okay...individual choices may vary - Lake water is dirty...needs to be cleaned - Birds around...ducks, herons..

This lake is dirty and unpleasant. It is surrounded by trees where birds roost at night so this is an extra hazard. There are either buildings under construction or sky scrapers around it so hardly attractive. On the plus side there is an amazing amount of bird life, herons, pelicans, ducks and egrets but I found the numerous crows very unpleasant as one landed on my head!

If you like seeing less touristy sites, then Lake Beira will allow you some quiet time and space to think. It can also be a little romantic. There's an island reached by a narrow metal bridge. You can also rent Swan paddle boats. There's also the Seema Malaka temple designed by Geoffrey Bawa.

My friend was driving me around from 7.15 am this morning. Traffic was not an issue being a Public Holiday. Quite a few stops made for photo opportunities- one such stop being Beira Lake. A pretty lake which is right in the middle of Colombo.
We went around for a walk, there is a bridge between which connects with a small park made inside the lake
This lake is located along side busy roads and construction sites . Good for evening walks as the view is amazing . Lake is little polluted and provides boat rides . Quite a famous site for couples
located at colombo, couples can do swan boat riding, but now a little bit polluted. gangarama temple, palace of prime minister in sri lanka are located nearby.

Visiting this mile long lake is a pleasant thing to do while in Colombo. The highlight of this lake is the Buddhist Temple, Seema Malaka, part of the Gangaramaya Temple Complex which you can pay $2 to visit both. The temple is a cool spot to chill on a hot day.

Beira Lake is right next to Seema Malaka temple and is a nice place to chill out on a cool day - it's a hot spot for couples but there's a great view for anyone to enjoy here especially at night when it's lit up. You can stroll down the quiet walkways under the shade of trees, paddle out on the lake on a swan-boat, visit the water-temple on the lake, cross the bridge to lovers' island, or have some juice or tea nearby. It is home to some birds and small animals but is mainly crowded with love-birds :)
We had stayed in a hotel from which this lake was very clearly visible, the lake looks soothing and nice, there is a temple where they ask you for a tourist fee of 300 LKR just to pray!!

Excellent cozy place in Colombo. Temple by the lake is more attractive to visit this location as well as for some good photographs. Only in day time can enter in to the temple but evenings are more attractive with the view.
It is just another city lake. But definitely adds charm and beauty to colombo. The lake looks neat and clean.

depending on where you are standing round the beira lake your opinion might be different with the change of scenery.  the best i got is from gangarama end.  on a cool evening it is relaxing to watch all those pelicans & fish-eating birds rally round the waters teaming with fish, but not all places around the beira lake is fresh & clean.

This lake has a working temple and is very peaceful You walk along a wooden jetty to the temple climb some steps into a wooden hut You might find ppl worshipping here Further along the lake there are swan shaped boats and picnic areas A serene and peaceful lake amongst the hustle and bustle

this place was done up by Gota former minister to the present level. hwr the new govt has not maintained with bad smell & filthy water. also too many pictures of Gods from the temple which ruins the view. hope the mucipality wakes up to bring it back to former glory

Its a romantic walk to go around the Beira Lake with your better half. A place that get busy on day times due to commercial buildings at surround, but evenings its getting quite and peaceful. There is a small island that you can go by a hanging bridge and the place is very much photographycal. You can have some self driven boat rides too.
This lake near the ceter of town is a nice walk with interesting trees and an island which once housed prisioners.

The Beira Lake know as to get the stuff through the boats in those days to the city and with the development it has abandoned and just retain as a lake for the middle of the city for the part of the landscape and part  of the city attraction maintained by the Local forces . Local are use to use the small island to walk through the hanging bridge and few duck boats for a ride in the evening with your family or love ones.
Situated in the centre with roads and building all around, its small lake where you can see the other end easily. No so great landscapes and highly over rated i believe.
This was a filthy place when I was small. But now cleaned & so beautiful to walk around. In 2020 it wili even more beautiful after the new constructions surrounding will be completed

Staying at the taj samudra it is just a stones throw from there . one can approach it quickly from the parking lot exit. good to walk before the traffic piles on. best time 6 to seven am and 7 to 9 pm.

We walked halfway around the lake and then went to the little island in the lake. It is an interesting sight to have a little bit of nature between the rising concrete structures. A lot of people were relaxing, watching the birds or hired a boat. We had a great time. Go also have a look at the temple on the lake.

Surrounded by the cityscape this lake is a beautiful place to sit and enjoy the city of Colombo.  With many ducks to keep you amused, this lake also features Buddhist temples to visit, park benches to sit on, and many grassed areas to enjoy.  Well worth a visit.
Go in the early morning or in the evening and you will witness a nice view. The middle of the lake and the view of surrounding area is very nice. Can take some nice photos and good for relaxing.
Was only planning to be there for an hour to visit Gangaramaya and get a  good look at the lake.  Enjoyed the nice view of the city across the lake and some waterfowl.
It's like a mirror in the city. Consisting gangaramaya and seema malaka as well  Very beautiful surrounding area
Nice place to spend sometime around this lake. Our hotel Cinnamon lakeside is located at the lake. We had lake view room and it was a very nice view and experience.
As many other places in Colombo, needs (and deserves) an urban "lifting", but has already a great potential. Attention when walking with the birds dejections.
The Beira lake is a popular places for walks and assignations but has seen better days. There is a very nice temple on the lake, but the lake itself needs a thoroughly good clean up.

Beira Lake is located in the heart of the city of Colombo. It cannot be compared with lakes in Europe or China as regards beauty of the place but still it gives a splendid view to Colombo city which otherwise has nothing special to offer to the inquisitive traveler. It has two distinct parts both connected by a canal. The main part is not very far from Gangaramaya Temple.  It is surrounded by many large business buildings in the city and provides a beautiful landscape to the city. It is also a love spot for the romantic couples and cool evening place for the locals in hot summer days. It needs to be well maintained. It occupied approximately 410 Acres of land 100 years ago but now has been reduced to mere 160 Acres due to various reasons. Two centuries ago the lake was used to transport goods within the city. The lake is fed by a river and it spills to the Indian Ocean at Galle Face.
It is kept in a very bad situation, very dirty and badly maintained. Nothing to see nor to do over there.

A large lake which is surrounded by busy roads and a few major construction sites. However, from my accommodation it's part of a nice view out towards the sea, always something to watch. But it looks dirty on closer inspection and at times a little smelly. There are plans to pedestrianise one of the roads on completion of a 70 floor residential block, maybe this will give the impetus to tidy up and clean the area and lake. There are white swan boats to hire to go out into the lake. To one side there is a temple which makes for an interesting visit. When the lake is lit up from all sides with coloured lights it's a lovely sight, especially when there are festivals and chanting going on. The areas around can become very congested, but it's a family time and feels safe and a happy time.
We visited the lake by night with the coloured lights glissening on the surface.  Walked around the perimeter which is a lovely stroll.  Quite romantic.
a very nice and cool lake in the city. what made is good is some good tourstic places near it and good seating arrangement near it.
This time when I visited, the lake was a in deep green color. But what was most enjoyable about this place is the wild birds, especially the Pelicans.

We visited the lake mainly to see the temple, but we actually enjoyed the calm of walking around the lake. We did our walk on a Sunday, so traffic was quiet, so it was quite peaceful walking around the lake. It's a nice escape from the noise of the city and an easy walk. Beware of Tu Tuk drivers driving around the lake asking for business, we just said no and they went away, but I'd imagine for some people this could be annoying. Although only a couple approached us, not annoying for us.
Nothing special about this place. It is poorly mentioned lake you can you barely enjoy the time spent here.

There is a path all the way round the lake and it could be quite attractive if the water and the pathway was tidied up a bit. Unfortunately it is dirty and in some places smelly so having done the walk once you are unlikely to repeat it Great shame and a lost opportunity by Colombo to add a decent tourist attraction
The Most worst place on earth. I hate the bad smell and the color of the water. Crows are ever where.
Ok if you have nothing better to do!!just a large lake which looked quite dirty.went on a trip in a large swan !!
I saw a couple of rowing boats and that was about it. The lake is a dark green colour and gives off a pong.
very nice place to walk around and see the choreography of the black ducks! There is a square in the middlle you can reach by a bridge.
I took a swan shaped pedilow out onto the lake and it was great . You can walk around , adding discreet counting couples .
Not so clean, but you can take swan an ride around lake. They have a budhist temple too, but ticket is 300 lkr and you can't see anything special
This lake is supposed to be a tourist attraction.  You cannot even walk around it properly.  Complete & utter waste of time.  Avoid.

There is a small Budhha temple, but charge too high Lankan Rs. 300 per person to visit this place.  The best thing is you go to Gangaramaya temple first.  Once you pay the fee there, then you don't need to pay here again.
Head over to Beira Lake for a cool respite from the crowds ut most importantly to visit the shrine designed by Geoffrey Bawa.
The swan boats, the skyscrapers behind and of course Geoffrey Bawa's Seema Malaka temple on the lake itself. Recommended.

The periphery of the lake is a good enough place for a long peaceful walk; various types of birds can be seen in the water; the area around is upmarket residential/commercial with some decent dining options
Great to walk around it in the mornings. Nice views of Colombo, the lake being in the heart of the city.
If you are looking for a place to take snaps in the evening, Beira Lake is one of the most attractive locations in Colombo-adjoining high rise buildings and the city's commercial district.

Mornings or evenings, if you wish to go for a walk or meet and chit chat with a friend with a little peace around, this is an ideal place. You get an island in the middle of the lake and a small restaurant run by the Sri Lanka Army by the side of the lake. There're swan boats if you like a ride. Bridal couples can be seen taking photographs in here and many romantic couples also are found around. Please do not throw waste around once you're done with your meals and drinks as it is us who have the responsibility to keep these public places clean. If we don't take care of our own city or country why would you think the foreigners will?

This lake is near the Gangaramaya Buddhist temple (around 100 meters away). The lake itself has a small temple, with a lot of Buddha idols in various peaceful poses. I could also spot some idols of Hindus gods, too. The lake also includes a small park - that was slightly crowded on the day I visited it. One can walk around the whole lake in around 25-30 minutes, with stops for photos and taking in the scenery. Be aware the Colombo is usually hot and humid - and there is no shade while walking around most of the lake. Worth a visit if you are in Colombo.

ideal place for visiting in colombo. if you wish to have self boat ride with some one in colombo, this is the best place. if you a birder and if you want to see some birds, this can be a good place. spot billed pelicans are available here.you can take some good and cheep foods in here. nice place within a busy town.
This was close to our hotel and it was a delightful place to walk.  Do this in the early part of the morning though, as it's quite exposed and will get very hot in the middle of the day.
nice lake scorner has many garbage people purposely spoiling the lake you can have nice paddling swan boat ride

A quiet and peaceful place which is a welcome relief in a busy, traffic-clogged city.  Great views of the modern buildings in Colombo Fort when you walk around the lake. The small temple is also photogenic.  And there is a small island accessible by a suspension bridge.  Good for a visit with kids.  There is a playarea on the island and you can rent paddle boats in the shape of huge swans.

The lake is lovely to walk around and the temple is very well looked after. Again 200 r each and usually you have to take your shoes off to walk around the outside, but as the ground was very hot we only took them off to go inside.The wood is great and the whole area  is well maintained  and kept clean. There are lots of Buddha statues around the temple

fist worning is dont sweem ant tuch water. not clean. dark green colour with more polution. but around the lake evening walk for best place ..... now for kids paddle boats service available. and middle of the lake you can see nice and small island. you can goto that islant by very mordentype brige. for this place some improvement want to do.....

This is a part of Beira lake. There is an island in the midst of the lake, once this place was infamous for detaining slaves (This area is called Slave Island even now). Now of course the most expensive business square. This lake had very well done and you can walk around, It will be preferable if you could walk in a crowd because some unwanted people may disturb you. There are some great places nearby, like Prime Ministers official residence called Temple Trees, Gangaramaya Buddhist Temple etc., There are no admission fees to this place. Make sure you go in the morning or evening it very picturesque place. Weekends are crowded. There are some eateries around. Boating facilities are provided for a nominal rate(LKR 100, less than a 1 USD.) This place is very well connected by public transportation.
The lake is one landmark and is central to Colombo. One can go around walking and there is a great walkway. Boating is available and to the temple within the lake. A quiet and spiritual experience.
This water body was neglected some time back. Now the Government is developing these areas for transport and also water is more cleaner now.

Beautiful lake in the business center of the city. There is a small island with benches under a large tree in the middle of the lake. Next - a Buddhist temple on the water. In the lake live pelicans. You can cheaply go on catamarans (02/2015 it costed $ 1).

I was a sole traveler and was clicking picture which even the locals do. But as the staff got to know that i am not a local he forced me to pay entrance fees. I said it its not written anywhere but he threatened me to throw me and my phone in the lake. He was standing in front of me not allowing me to go and when i said i will call the police he said i will not let you go until you pay the fees. Since i was a girl and a sole tourist  i had no option but to pay him that money and escape from the place. It was very sad that temples loot tourist at Sri Lanka by forcing them and threatening them. I wanted to put some donation in the box before leaving but this experience just showed the way such sacred places are looting from tourist and this act of extortion from places like temples is not expected at all !!!!

Bus No 101 (Pettah-Moratuwa) passes infront of this lake. There is also an hanging bridge which take you to the center of the lake, which is folked by local young couples for romantic dates (not suitable for family with young kids).
This lake is in the city center.This is surrounded by banks businesses and food out lets.Its a good place to walk around early evening and early mornings.
Very nice place, calm lake... with a small island in the middle connected with a modern walk bridge. romantic moments for couples...

If you need to kill some time or to spend some time with a loved one, this would be a good place. Entrance is free and there is an island in the middle of the lake that can be accessed via a bridge. Good photo locations and food outlet are available.You can get a boat ride as well, but not sure about the price, it is maintained by SL Navy. Mornings and evenings are good time periods to visit. Parking is available but limited. There are few attractions around such as Gangaramaya temple, dont forget to visit the temple if you happen to get into this place.
Not much to say; a few eateries around it, some birdies doing their thing, a pleasant stroll away from the hustle and bustle.

Beira Lake is a tranquil body of water right in the heart of the bustling capital city. It is actually comprised of two bodies of water linked by a canal. The lake was used by the Portuguese and English for transporting goods across the city and one can truly get the feel of this historic importance in the area today. Many of Colombo's significant business facilities are in the vicinity. One can enjoy walking around or taking a trip on the water and visiting the Temple here. Gradually this lake is being transformed in a major recreational area of the city and it is well worth visiting.

A lake around Central Colombo. We only had the opportunity to visit this place during the late evening time when it was raining and could not enjoy it much with all the downpour and lack of shelter around the place.

The lake came alive for few days during Vesak Day festival. It was beautiful to see the reflection of lights and colors on the lake. In fact the whole Colombo city came alive with lights, pandols, and lanterns display during this time. Definitely worth checking out Colombo during Vesak festival.

It's good place to go. Try boating. The water in d lake is not really clean. But do try and mediate in d temple, as it has that peace. In short, after doing a lot of site seeing through out the day, this would be a good thing before you wind up.
This area has excellent walking pths and that is what I would do and as you walk you can take a few worthy pics..

there's nithing to do here but look at a dirty little lake... if it was pristine and breathtaking then I could imagine propping up against a tree and reading. If it had entertainment for the kids like carriage or train rides or maybe boat rides, then okay but it is only a dirty body of water. drive past

Once neglected and dirty mass of water. It is getting a long overdue face lift with walking paths, benches, root planting and lots of beautification. Looks like it will regain its former beauty and popular place for relaxing/ jogging walking for city dwellers and visitors
Very peaceful and a beautiful place for photography. A nice little temple in the middle adds more beauty for the place..
A lake familiar from childhood has had a face lift which is very commendable, it has been cleaned up & it has enhanced the beauty of Colombo.

A lake within the city of Colombo, the lake consists of 2 parts; the greater Beira and Lesser Beira. Lesser Beira bordering Nawam Mawatha and the Indian Ocean is the Main Attraction. The Seema Malaka Temple is Situated on the Lake, the walking track around the lake and the Swan Boat service makes its a popular evening spot. Is Situated within walking distance from Many hotels and the Crescat Mall. Greater Beira has been an ancient commercial water transport means within the city, now is the Home of the Colombo Rowing club and hosts a few popular regattas between clubs and Schools in the city
